t: Woot, Amazon's Other Website, Is Having Incredible Deals Today on Bedding, Tech, and More
s: February 28, 2020 - Here's everything you need to know about Amazon's other site, Woot. Yes, it's legit and it could save you big bucks.

Woot's the original daily deals site, founded in 2004 and snatched up by Amazon in 2010. Originally, Woot offered just one product per day until we sold out. Today, we offer special daily deals and other limited-time offers across seven categories.

February 24, 2025 - Woot (originally W00t) is an American Internet retailer based in the Dallas suburb of Carrollton, Texas. Founded by electronics wholesaler Matt Rutledge, it debuted on July 12, 2004. Woot's main website originally offered only one discounted product each day, often a piece of computer hardware ...

It's easy! Use the Log in with Amazon button on our sign in screen then enter your Amazon Prime login information. When you place an order, you'll see your shipping benefit applied at checkout. Remember to check the individual offer pages for any shipping details and restrictions.

t: Woot's Deal Of The Day: Woot! -- Amazon Buys It. Price? $110 Million | TechCrunch
s: May 5, 2024 - Woot has been acquired by Amazon, as they briefly note on their blog today with a big "woot!" Well, okay, their exact words were "Holy crap!" This is a great deal for daily online bargin service as, similar to Zappos and Audible, they'll continue to be run autonomously under the Amazon banner.

t: Why Is Amazon Buying Woot? The Answer May Surprise You - CBS News
s: July 2, 2010 - Amazon (AMZN) has agreed to buy Woot, the clearance site that sells one item per day. But Amazon already has a similar last-chance feature on its own site, and it nearly always stocks the same items that Woot (albeit at a slightly higher price). So why buy Woot?
